TopicTitle: Starlight Breaker - My first interplanetary explorer

Articles.Content:
Though actually getting it off the ground was a bitch and a half. Haven't been doing so well since they changed the miles per gallon in the tanks, personally, but here she is. 8 nukes under the hood, seats 8. Front cabin is fully survivable if one should happen to encounter atmospheric turbulence. It you're in the aft section, well, you'll have a nice view on the way down

Profile shot, note the two broadside clamps. Future expansion for probes or fuel.

Aft docking port, intended to tow full-up landers.

There's actually two big fuel tanks underneath the external tank array. Intakes are purely for show

A better view of the aft quarter and the extra housing.

Still got to figure out what mods creat all the pretty lights I see some people sporting and have a little bit to add anyway, but overall, a success... After many, many failures to orbit.
Hmmm... Looks like those nukes are going to blow the solar panels off. Must they be retracted during burns?

Hmmm... Looks like those nukes are going to blow the solar panels off. Must they be retracted during burns?
Definitely retract those badboys for extended burns. I would have put them higher on the body except that I use most of the realestate for the lift vehicle to put the thing into orbit.
